subject: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts?
msgSnippet: We ve done the same with our JUnit.  I ve heard a few other people on the list mention modifying JUnit to count asserts.  Is there a good reason that it isn t
messageBody:
We've done the same with our JUnit. I've heard a few other people on the
list mention modifying JUnit to count asserts. Is there a good reason that
it isn't part of the framework? Since a few of us have already done it, I'm
sure we could make the change pretty easily.

Matt

-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jason.rogers@...]
Sent: Monday, July 16, 2001 10:40 AM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a thrown
exception ?


We have modified JUnit to count asserts, because we find that to be
interesting data for metrics. Therefore, since we are implying that
something went wrong when it was supposed to, we do an assert to add to the
count.
